moves.1. e4 e5: We move our king's pawns to open our queens and kingside bishops...
moves.2. Nf3 Nc6: ...then we develop our knights, mine to defend my pawn.
moves.3. c3: He develops his queen from the other diagonal...
moves.3... d5: ...and I pressure his king's pawn with my queen's...
moves.4. d3: ...and he brings his queen's pawn up...
moves.4... dxe4 5. dxe4: ...and we swap, opening up the d-file...
moves.6... Bg4: ...allowing me to pin his knight down with my bishop...
moves.8. Kc2: His king moves off his starting rank...
moves.9. Ng5: His knight is now eyeing up my rooks...
moves.9... Be6: ...so I move my bishop back to cover the f7 square.
moves.10. b3 Bc5: I now move up my bishop to give my kingside rook more freedom, and to eye up his f-pawn...
moves.12... Rdf8: ...and I move my castling rook behind my f-pawn to cover, leaving my rooks in passive positions.
moves.13. f3: The f-pawn move out of the way...
moves.14. Nh3: ...forcing it to the only safe place.
moves.14... a6: I move up my right flank pawn, eyeing up one of the doubled c-pawns...
moves.15... Be3: ...I eye it up, along with the bishop, using mine...
moves.16. Re1: ...but as the rook attacks my bishop...
moves.17... b5: Now I eye up his c-4 pawn...
moves.18... Nd7: So I eye it up with my knight...
moves.20. Rab1: ...but he declines to take it, instead taking the b-file...
moves.20... bxc3: ...which is open with me capturing his pawn...
moves.21... Na5 22. Kb4 Nb7: WHAT was I thinking here, putting my knight there to attack the pawn...
moves.23... a5+: However, I save them both by checking with my flank pawn...
moves.26. Rec1: He brings his other rook to cover the pawn...
moves.26... f5: ...so I advance a pawn to attack one of his...
moves.27. Rb7: ...but he pushes his rook too far...
moves.29. Rb1+: His remaining rook attacks my king...
moves.30. Ba7: He moves his bishop to attack my knight, no doubt hoping to win it, and make a net gain...
moves.30... Nc6+: ...but my knight forks his king and bishop...
moves.32. Kxa7: ...and he does take my knight, but it cost him his bishop.
moves.33... Kd7: ...and although moving the king off the bottom rank exposes a rook...
moves.34... Rxf8: ...it was connected to its twin, which removes the checking rook.
moves.37. Nf2 c4 38. Nd1 c3 39. Nxc3: ...and as it is removed by the knight...
moves.42. a6 Ra4: ...but it must now cover my right-hand flank...
moves.46... e2: ...my e-pawn would make sure it wasn't in vain.
